name: Langkawi
fun_fact: Fun fact: Langkawi is a UNESCO Global Geopark with 550-million-year-old rock formations, and it's also a duty-free island - making it one of the cheapest places in Southeast Asia to buy chocolate, alcohol, and imported goods!

hero_dishes.name: Laksa
hero_dishes.description: Spicy coconut curry noodle soup with fish, prawns, and vegetables
hero_dishes.origin_story: Each Malaysian region has its version - Langkawi's is influenced by both Thai and Malay flavors due to its location
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Warung Pok Ya, Tomato Nasi Kandar, local kopitiams

hero_dishes.name: Nasi Campur
hero_dishes.description: Rice with various pre-cooked dishes - pick what you want buffet-style
hero_dishes.origin_story: The everyday Malaysian meal - choose from curries, vegetables, fried items, and sambal
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Warung stalls throughout Langkawi, Nasi Kandar restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Ikan Bakar
hero_dishes.description: Grilled fish marinated in sambal and wrapped in banana leaves
hero_dishes.origin_story: Essential Malaysian BBQ - the banana leaf keeps the fish moist while imparting flavor
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Tanjung Rhu beach stalls, Pantai Cenang restaurants, seafood restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Roti Canai
hero_dishes.description: Flaky, layered flatbread served with dhal and curry
hero_dishes.origin_story: Indian-influenced Malaysian breakfast staple - the dough is stretched and folded for layers
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Mamak stalls throughout the island, especially at breakfast

signature_drinks.name: Teh Tarik
signature_drinks.description: 'Pulled' tea - hot tea with condensed milk poured between two cups to create froth
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: The pulling aerates and cools it - watch the mamak stall theatrics

signature_drinks.name: Fresh Coconut
signature_drinks.description: Young coconut water straight from the shell
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Everywhere on the beaches - the perfect island refreshment

food_culture_notes: Duty-free status means cheaper imported goods and chocolate
Pantai Cenang beach strip has the most tourist restaurants
Local warungs offer better food at lower prices than beach restaurants
Night markets (pasar malam) rotate through different locations
